Unit testing for A.A. Samarasinghe Opticians 
Page 2 
 
 
Unit Testing 
Introduction 
This report summarizes the test results for the AI-powered consultation booking chatbot 
developed for A.A. Samarasinghe Opticians. The new system addresses inefficiencies in the 
manual reservation process by automating appointment scheduling through natural language 
processing. The tests confirm secure user authentication, robust appointment management, 
and efficient admin functionality. All test cases have passed, indicating that the system is 
ready for deployment. 
 
1. Unit Tests for User Model (UserTest) 
Objective: 
To validate the core functionalities of the User model, ensuring security and data integrity. 
Test Results: 
• U

RISK LOG FORM 007 
Ref: 
Version:007 
Programme:AGILE PROJECT 
MANAGEMENT 
 
Project: AI Chatbot for the official 
website of 
A. A. Samarasinghe Opticians. 
PRINCE2 
RISK 
IDENTIFIER: 
017 
Description: No unit testing was conducted during Sprint 1 and 
Sprint 2, which may lead to undetected issues in the final 
product. 
Risk Category: 
 Technical 
Probability: 
Medium 
Impact: 
There may be bugs in the final product, leading to functionality 
issues and poor user experience. 
Proximity: 
Near-term 
Proximity 
Countermeasures: 
Implement automated unit testing using Laravel PHPUnit for upcoming sprints to ensure code quality 
and early bug detection. 
Owner: 
Quality manger- 
L.G.V.O.Wijerathne
. 
Author: 
Risk manager- 
H.P.J.Visna 
Date Identified: 
14/03/2025 
Date of Last 
Update: 
14/03/2025 
Current Status: 
Open

Feasibility Report 
 
Project Overview 
The proposed Document Management System (DMS) is designed for personal use, offering a 
comprehensive and efficient way to manage documents offline. The system aims to provide users with 
an organized structure to store, access, and interact with documents, while ensuring that key 
functionalities such as search capabilities, version control, audit trails, and reminders are available for 
seamless user experience. 
 
Project Objectives 
• To identify existing systems and solution which are given to the users. 
• To design user friendly interface to ensure user interaction. 
• To implement Attribute-Based Search component to locate documents efficiently. 
• To implement a flexible search component, enable users to do custom query. 
• To implement an audit trail logging component to track user interaction with documents. 
• To implement a reminder component to remind about forthcoming academics activities. 
• To test and evaluate the system with

Application Design and Interoperability for Managing
Personal Information in the Semantic Desktop
?
Huiyong XiaoIsabel F. Cruz
Department of Computer Science
University of Illinois at Chicago
{hxiao|ifc}@cs.uic.edu
Abstract.A number ofsemantic desktopframeworks have been proposed that
address different issues in personal information management, including the or-
ganization, manipulation, and visualization of personal data. Our approach com-
prises a layered multi-ontology based framework, MOSE. In this paper, we de-
scribe how the architecture of MOSE supports an application centered seman-
tic approach to personal information management. In particular, we introduce a
method based on the Model-View-Controller paradigm forpersonal information
application(PIA) development, as enabled by the underlying semantic data or-
ganization and specified by thePIA designer. We also introduce the notion of
parameterized channeland describe how it supports the interaction among mul-
tiple visualiza
